|sessionend3 = March 3, 1815 |previous = 12th |next = 14th }} The 'Thirteenth
United States Congress' was a meeting of the legislative branch of the United
States federal government, consisting of the United States Senate and the
United States House of Representatives. It met in Washington, D.C. from March
4, 1813 to March 4, 1815, during the fifth and sixth years of James Madison's
presidency. The apportionment of seats in the House of Representatives was
based on the Third Census of the United States in 1810. Both chambers had a
Democratic-Republican majority.

, President of the Senate]] ]] ]]
